alignas.note: Useful for SIMD or hardware requirements.
alignas.summary: Specify alignment of a type or object.
alignas.title: alignas

alignof.note: Often equals alignof(T) at compile time.
alignof.summary: Yield required alignment of a type.
alignof.title: alignof

auto.title: auto
auto.summary: Type deduction for variables and return types.
auto.note: Prefer auto when the initializer shows the type.

bool.title: bool
bool.note: Integral type with values true and false; size is implementation-defined.

break.title: break
break.summary: Exit the nearest loop or switch.
break.note: Transfers control out of the innermost enclosing loop or switch statement.

case.title: case
case.note: Each case label must be unique within the same switch. Falls through if no break.

catch.title: catch
catch.note: Used after try. Catches thrown exceptions by type, in order of appearance.

char.title: char
char.note: Represents a single byte character. Signedness is implementation-defined.

char16_t.title: char16_t
char16_t.note: Used for UTF-16 encoded text; has size 16 bits and distinct type from char and wchar_t.

char32_t.title: char32_t
char32_t.note: Used for UTF-32 encoded text; has size 32 bits and distinct type from char and wchar_t.

char8_t.title: char8_t
char8_t.note: Introduced for type-safe UTF-8 handling; distinct from plain char.

class.title: class
class.note: Classes define user types with members and access control. Default access is private.

co_await.title: co_await
co_await.summary: Suspend execution until awaited coroutine result is ready.
co_await.note: Used inside coroutines to asynchronously wait for an awaitable object.

co_return.title: co_return
co_return.summary: Return a value or signal completion from a coroutine.
co_return.note: Ends coroutine execution; may produce a final result for the promise object.

co_yield.title: co_yield
co_yield.summary: Yield a value to the coroutine's caller.
co_yield.note: Suspends coroutine after producing a value; resumes on next iteration or await.

concept.summary: Constrain template arguments with boolean predicates.
concept.title: concept

const.note: Top-level const not in function type; beware pointers' cv-qualification.
const.summary: Declare objects or members as read-only.
const.title: const

const_cast.note: Undefined behavior if you modify an object originally defined const.
const_cast.summary: Cast to add/remove const/volatile or adjust cv on pointers/refs.
const_cast.title: const_cast

consteval.note: Must produce a constant. Cannot be called at run time.
consteval.summary: Immediate function. Evaluated at compile time.
consteval.title: consteval

constexpr.note: Usable in constant expressions. Functions have constexpr constraints.
constexpr.summary: Potentially evaluated at compile time. Implies const for objects.
constexpr.title: constexpr

constinit.note: For globals and statics. Guarantees no dynamic initialization.
constinit.title: constinit

continue.title: continue
continue.summary: Skip to the next iteration of the nearest loop.
continue.note: Immediately jumps to the next loop iteration; does not exit the loop.

decltype.summary: Form a type from the declared type of an expression.
decltype.title: decltype

default.summary: Provide default case in switch or defaulted special member.
default.title: default

delete.note: Use delete[] for arrays. Prefer smart pointers.
delete.summary: Destroy object or deallocate memory; or delete function.
delete.title: delete

do.title: do
do.summary: Begin a do-while loop that executes at least once.
do.note: The loop body runs before the condition is checked; useful for input-validation loops.

double.title: double
double.note: Typically 64-bit IEEE 754; preferred default for floating-point arithmetic.

dynamic_cast.note: Needs polymorphic base. Returns nullptr or throws bad_cast.
dynamic_cast.summary: Safe downcast across polymorphic types at runtime.
dynamic_cast.title: dynamic_cast

else.title: else
else.summary: Define the alternative branch of an if statement.
else.note: Always use braces to avoid the dangling else problem.

enum.title: enum
enum.summary: Define an enumeration type with named integral constants.
enum.note: Prefer enum class (scoped enum) for type safety and no implicit conversions.

explicit.summary: Prevent implicit conversions or copy-list init on constructors.
explicit.title: explicit

export.title: export
export.summary: Export declarations from a module interface unit.
export.note: Used to make module entities visible to importers; replaces the old, unused template export keyword from C++98.

extern.title: extern
extern.summary: Declare a variable or function with external linkage.
extern.note: Indicates that the definition is provided elsewhere; often used in headers to declare globals or C linkage blocks.

false.title: false
false.note: Used with bool expressions; converts to integer 0 when needed.

float.title: float
float.note: Typically 32-bit IEEE 754; use when memory or bandwidth is critical, otherwise prefer double.

for.title: for
for.summary: Traditional counted or range-based loop construct.
for.note: Use range-based for (C++11) for cleaner iteration over containers; avoid modifying container size during iteration.

friend.note: Alternative patterns often better than friend.
friend.title: friend

goto.title: goto
goto.summary: Unconditional jump to a labeled statement.
goto.note: Avoid in structured programming; occasionally used for low-level error handling or cleanup.

if.title: if
if.summary: Conditional execution based on a boolean expression.
if.note: Since C++17, supports an initializer (if (auto x = f(); x)); always use braces for clarity.

import.title: import
import.summary: Import a named module or header unit.
import.note: Used to access exported declarations from a C++20 module; replaces preprocessor-based includes for modular code.

inline.summary: Suggest inlining; define ODR-used entities in headers; inline variables.
inline.title: inline

int.title: int
int.note: Usually 32 bits on modern systems; use fixed-width types like int32_t for portability.

long.title: long
long.summary: Integer type at least as wide as int.
long.note: Width varies by platform (32-bit on Windows, 64-bit on most Unix-like systems).

module.title: module
module.summary: Define a module or declare a module interface unit.
module.note: Used to define named modules in C++20; improves build times and encapsulation compared to header-based includes.

mutable.summary: Allow mutation of member in const object or lambda capture.
mutable.title: mutable

namespace.note: Use nested namespace syntax: namespace a::b { }
namespace.title: namespace

noexcept.summary: Specify and query that a function does not throw.
noexcept.title: noexcept

not.title: not
not.note: Rarely used; prefer ! for clarity and consistency.

not_eq.title: not_eq
not_eq.summary: Alternative token for != not equal operator.

nullptr.title: nullptr
nullptr.summary: Null pointer literal of type std::nullptr_t.
nullptr.note: Type-safe replacement for NULL and 0; canâ€™t be implicitly converted to integral types.

operator.summary: Declare or define an operator overload or conversion.
operator.title: operator

or.title: or
or.note: Seldom used; prefer || for conventional style and readability.

or_eq.title: or_eq
or_eq.summary: Alternative token for |= bitwise OR assignment.

private.title: private
private.summary: Access specifier restricting access to the class and its friends.
private.note: Default access level for class members; encapsulates implementation details.

protected.title: protected
protected.summary: Access specifier allowing access from the class, derived classes, and friends.
protected.note: Use for inheritance hierarchies; avoid overexposing internal details.

public.title: public
public.summary: Access specifier making members accessible from any scope.
public.note: Defines the external interface of a class; default for struct members.

reflexpr.title: reflexpr
reflexpr.summary: Obtain a metaobject describing a type, expression, or entity (Reflection TS).
reflexpr.note: Part of the Reflection Technical Specification; not in the standard yet.

register.title: register
register.summary: Storage-class specifier suggesting keeping a variable in a CPU register.
register.note: Deprecated and ignored in modern C++; has no effect on optimization.

requires.summary: Introduce a requires-clause or requires-expression for concepts.
requires.title: requires

return.title: return
return.summary: Exit a function and optionally provide a return value.
return.note: Triggers copy elision or NRVO where possible; returning local objects is efficient in modern C++.

short.title: short
short.summary: Signed integer type not wider than int.
short.note: Typically 16 bits; used when compact storage matters more than range.

signed.title: signed
signed.summary: Explicitly mark an integer type as signed.
signed.note: Rarely needed since int is signed by default; clarifies intent when mixed with unsigned types.

sizeof.title: sizeof
sizeof.summary: Return the size in bytes of a type or object at compile time.
sizeof.note: Does not evaluate its operand; sizeof(array) gives total byte size, not element count.

static.title: static
static.summary: Specify internal linkage, static storage duration, or class static members.
static.note: Inside functions defines static locals (persistent state); in classes defines shared members.

static_assert.title: static_assert
static_assert.summary: Perform compile-time assertion with an optional message.
static_assert.note: Useful for template constraints and validating invariants at compile time.

struct.title: struct
struct.summary: Define a class type with public members by default.
struct.note: Structs and classes are equivalent except for default access (public for struct, private for class).

switch.title: switch
switch.summary: Select among multiple branches based on an integral or enum expression.
switch.note: Each case label must be unique; remember to use break to prevent fall-through unless intentional.

template.note: Alias and variable templates reduce boilerplate.
template.summary: Declare a template (class, function, alias, variable).
template.title: template

this.title: this
this.summary: Pointer to the current object within a non-static member function.
this.note: Has type T* or const T* depending on the function; unavailable in static member functions.

thread_local.title: thread_local
thread_local.summary: Declare an object with thread storage duration.
thread_local.note: Each thread has its own instance of a thread_local variable; initialized on first use in that thread.

throw.title: throw
throw.summary: Throw an exception or rethrow the current one if used without an operand.
throw.note: Use bare throw in catch blocks to rethrow; prefer exceptions for truly exceptional conditions only.

true.title: true
true.note: Evaluates to integer 1 in arithmetic contexts; used with bool expressions.

try.title: try
try.summary: Begin a block of code to be monitored for exceptions.
try.note: Must be followed by one or more catch clauses or a function-try-block; works with constructors and destructors too.

typedef.title: typedef
typedef.summary: Create a type alias using an existing type.
typedef.note: Replaced by using declarations in modern C++; still common in C interoperability code.

typeid.title: typeid
typeid.summary: Return runtime type information (RTTI) as a std::type_info object.
typeid.note: Requires RTTI; for polymorphic objects, yields dynamic type when applied to dereferenced pointers.

typename.summary: Treat dependent name as a type in templates.
typename.title: typename

union.title: union
union.summary: Define a type whose members share the same memory location.
union.note: Only one member is active at a time; use std::variant for safer type-safe alternatives.

unsigned.title: unsigned
unsigned.summary: Specify that an integer type is unsigned.
unsigned.note: Unsigned integers wrap on overflow; be cautious mixing with signed values.

using.note: Prefer using over typedef; C++20 using enum.
using.summary: Introduce alias or using-declaration; start using-enum list.
using.title: using

virtual.summary: Enable dynamic dispatch and polymorphism on member functions.
virtual.title: virtual

void.title: void
void.summary: Indicate the absence of a value or an incomplete type.
void.note: Used for functions that return nothing, pointers to untyped memory, and template specializations requiring an empty return type.

volatile.note: Not a threading primitive; use atomics/mutexes.
volatile.summary: Prevent certain optimizations for memory-mapped I/O, etc.
volatile.title: volatile

wchar_t.title: wchar_t
wchar_t.summary: Wide character type for extended character sets.
wchar_t.note: Size and encoding are implementation-defined; use char16_t or char32_t for portable Unicode handling.

while.title: while
while.summary: Loop construct that repeats while a condition is true.
while.note: Evaluates the condition before each iteration; use do-while for at-least-once execution.

xor.title: xor
xor.note: Rarely used; prefer ^ for clarity and conventional style.

xor_eq.title: xor_eq
xor_eq.summary: Alternative token for ^= bitwise XOR assignment.
